channel.title: Emmy Awards on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: In ‘The Remarkable Life of Iberlin,’ a Disabled Gamer Finds Accessibility and Influence He Couldn’t in the Real World
item.description: The documentary directed by Benjamin Ree captures how Mats Steen, a young Norwegian man with muscular dystrophy, impacted lives through ‘World of Warcraft.’

item.title: Mark Ronson’s Latest High Note
item.description: The high-flying DJ, record producer and songwriter who produced SNL’s 50th anniversary concert just collected a brand new honor: Emmy nominee.

item.title: ‘Somebody Somewhere’ Co-Writer Bridget Everett About Telling a Story of Friendship in the Series Finale
item.description: “It’s very special that the two of them are still the center of each other’s universe,” Everett says of the relationship between her character, Sam, and Jeff Hiller’s Joel.

item.title: ‘The Bear’ Is Really a Work Warning for All of Us
item.description: The show got a lot of attention for its restaurant industry commentary. But what it’s actually doing is telling us to get off the treadmill.

item.title: Emmys: Ted Danson and Mary Streenburgen Tapped for Bob Hope Humanitarian Award
item.description: Danson and Steenburgen, who have been married since 1995, are the first couple to receive the honor, which has been presented irregularly since 2002.

item.title: MomTok on Top: ‘The Secret Lives of Mormon Wives’ Earns First Emmy Nomination
